text: [Music]
hi this is Brian with Amazon Web
Services and in this short video I'm
gonna walk you through installing the
AWS plugin for visual studio and
configuring it to be able to do the work
against your your account this plugin is
fantastic for doing things such as
managing ec2 instances creating elastic
Beanstalk manage server environments or
even going service and doing lambda
coding as well as managing your back-end
data storage let's go take a look at how
to do this okay now that we're in Visual
Studio will click on tools and its
extensions and updates from this section
we're gonna click on the online area so
that we can find stuff online and we'll
search for AWS now comes up the AWS
toolkit for visual studio and we'll
download that at this point once this
download comes down we need to exit
Visual Studio and at that point the
install will happen so let's exit and we
wait just a little bit now the install
installer kicks off we hit modify and it
goes and runs through the installer
okay now that that is done we click on
close and we'll restart visual studio so
I'm going to click on Visual Studio 2017
now that this is up if the if it doesn't
show itself asking for your login
credentials we'll bring it up by
clicking view and AWS explorer this
brings up the ADA base Explorer it will
add a new account because I have no
account in there right now and I need to
access Kunis
go get those actually from the console
to create those I go over to the console
I click on services and I'm going to use
identity access management or I am from
here I'll click on users add a user and
this user I'm going to call my visual
studio user and I only need to give him
programmatic access he is not going to
be la this user ID won't login to the
console so after I give programmatic
access that is going to then come to a
screen where I want to say I'm going to
give mine full-blown administrator it's
up to you with role based access control
and I'll create the user now that this
user is created we have an access key in
a secret key I'm just going to download
the CSV file so that I don't have to cut
and paste these and that's all I need to

visual studio and import that CSV file
so that's in my downloads under the
credentials CSV I open that and say ok
and that's it I should be connected to
it we'll take a look here and make sure
it's working yeah I've got my default
thing let's go see if I change to the US
East region if we can see some of my VMs
so well click on Virginia expand ec to
take a look at instances and there they
are ok and that's how we do it we just

studio very quick and easy and we
